title: Engineering Manager Interview Guide
description: Demonstrate leadership, technical credibility, and team-building skills.

content.text: Engineering Manager interviews assess your ability to lead teams, deliver results, grow engineers, and maintain technical credibility. Expect a mix of leadership scenarios, technical discussions, and system design.

**What interviewers assess:**

- People management and team building
- Technical judgment and architecture skills
- Delivery and execution track record
- Handling conflict and difficult situations
- Hiring, coaching, and growing engineers

**Typical EM interview loop:**

1. **Recruiter screen** (30 min)
2. **Hiring manager screen** (60 min) - Leadership philosophy, background
3. **Onsite/Virtual loop** (5-6 hours):
   - Leadership/people management round
   - Technical/system design round
   - Cross-functional collaboration round
   - Execution/delivery round
   - Bar raiser/culture fit round
Have specific examples ready for: firing someone, handling underperformers, resolving team conflict, and making difficult prioritization calls.

items.text: Prepare stories for each leadership competency
Prepare your management philosophy and style
Have examples of engineers you've grown and promoted
Research the team's current challenges and tech stack
